content: to follow up what @Wesley Wiser and @pnkfelix mentioned here https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/238009-t-compiler.2Fmeetings/topic/.5Bweekly.20meeting.5D.202020-12-03.20.2354818/near/218708396
unsure if I understand exactly what are they requesting to do
do you want us to add in the summarization the milestone that's being used?
I think the request is just that when there is a PR that's nominated only for stable backport but not beta, we include a note whether the patch has already landed in beta somehow.
I'm not sure I understand the problem, why is this stable nominated and not beta nominated?
this is probably one of those details that we should include in the nomination report for any case where something is stable-nominated but not beta-nominated

Wesley Wiser said:

I think the request is just that when there is a PR that's nominated only for stable backport but not beta, we include a note whether the patch has already landed in beta somehow.

well, exactly, if it's just stable nominated and not beta nominated I'd guess that it is fixed in beta
In the case of this PR, it landed in nightly first but was later nominated for stable backport. At that time, nightly had already been promoted to beta so there's no reason to backport to beta.
I think the goal is just to make sure we're not forgetting to backport to beta

Wesley Wiser said:

I think the goal is just to make sure we're not forgetting to backport to beta

yeah, that's for sure
so you want us to explain why this is not beta nominated?
like saying there's no beta nom because this patch was added to beta here PR#link
Or mention that maybe it should be backported to beta as well if it looks like that was forgotten.
